full_summary:
=================
### Vessel Charter – Salish Sea Moorings 

**Reference:** cb-918-6803279, Amendment#: 8, Solicitation#: 30004661

**Brief Overview**
-----------------

This is an open tender for a vessel charter to service a total of 11 acoustic moorings and conduct conductivity, temperature, and depth (CTD) casts in the Salish Sea.

### Request for Proposal

A conditional set-aside under the Federal Government Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB) applies to this request for proposal. The Government of Canada reserves the right to limit the competition to Indigenous businesses if at least two compliant bids are received from businesses certified under the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB) criteria and listed in the Indigenous Business Directory. If the number of compliant Indigenous bids falls below two, non-Indigenous bids will be considered.

### Objective

The contractor must provide a seaworthy vessel with a crane and/or A-frame and winch, along with a competent, experienced, and physically fit crew to:

* Retrieve and deploy up to 11 acoustic moorings
* Perform CTD casts in the Salish Sea

Accommodation and work space for a minimum of two science crew members must also be provided.

### Scope of Work

The contractor will be responsible for servicing a total of 11 acoustic moorings in waters around the south coast of Vancouver Island, including:

* Swiftsure Bank
* Juan de Fuca Strait
* Haro Strait
* Boundary Pass
* Strait of Georgia

### Closing Date and Time

The tender closing date is January 5, 2024, at 13:00 hrs.

### Selection Criteria

The proposal with the lowest price will be selected.

### Additional Information

* Contracting entity: Fisheries and Oceans Canada
* Contact information: Karen Dolan, DFO.tenders-soumissions.MPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca, 782-377-7245
